name: scene
structure: Produces entries for different types of genres and worlds. The 'common' and 'rare' tables are generic and should be compatible with almost any world. To retain compatibility with most settings, the  non-generic tables should be called only from other tables by specifying their name directly.
note: Forked from the Five_room_dungeon generator on 2018-01-04.
sources: Dream Park: The Roleplaying Game, Five_room_dungeon

tables.name: hook
tables.explanation: How the protagonists get involved in the adventure.

tables.name: action hook
tables.explanation: Action hook initialization.

tables.name: action hook type
tables.explanation: Action hooks to involve the protagonists.

entries.v: Kidnapped{var:endheading} The {lib:synonym#troupe} has been taken as prisoners. It's time to find the way to freedom - and avenge!
Friend kidnapped{var:endheading} A friend of one of the characters (their {lib:friend#summary}) has been taken as a prisoner by the villain. The {lib:synonym#troupe} is off to the rescue!

Death of a friend{var:endheading} A friend of one of the characters (their {lib:friend#summary}) has died because the actions of the villain or the minions. It's the {lib:synonym#troupe}'s task to avenge the lost friend!
Attack{var:endheading} Someone has launched an attack that threatens what is dear to {lib:synonym#troupe}. The villain must be tracked to the hideaway and dealt with.

tables.name: development hook
tables.explanation: Action hook initialization.

tables.name: development hook type
tables.explanation: Development hooks to involve the protagonists.

entries.v: Memory loss{var:endheading} The {lib:synonym#troupe} has no recollection of how they have ended up in the present location. What is going on and who is behind this?
Discovery{var:endheading} The {lib:synonym#troupe} makes a remarkable discovery: a {lib:macguffin#detail}. [The discovery is in some way linked to this adventure's villain or treasure.]

Revelation{var:endheading} A surprising finding about their past changes the lives of the {lib:synonym#troupe}. The revealed information points to the adventure starting location as a source of additional information.
False accusation{var:endheading} The {lib:synonym#troupe} has been framed to be guilty of a crime they did not commit. They must flee from the accusations and catch the true culprit.
Looming threat{var:endheading} The villain is planning an evil deed and the {lib:synonym#troupe} must counter the plans before it is too late.

tables.name: action finale type

entries.v: Final Battle{var:endheading} A great battle againts the villain and the minions ensues. The result will determine the final fate of everyone involved!

entries.v: Final Revelation{var:endheading} The truth about the adventure's goal is finally revealed!

tables.name: resolution
tables.explanation: Resolution initialization

tables.name: resolution type
tables.explanation: Ending that ties everything together and possibly paves ground for continuing the story.

entries.v: Happy Ending{var:endheading} Everything turns out fine.
Villain Dies{var:endheading} The villain is dead and cannot threaten anyone anymore.
Villain Surrenders{var:endheading} After a tough fight, the villain is ready to give up and surrender to the {lib:synonym#troupe}.
Villain Escapes{var:endheading} The villain manages to flee from the {lib:synonym#troupe}.
Heroes Captured{var:endheading} The villain manages to capture the {lib:synonym#troupe}. Will they ever be able to escape? That is a different story...
Heroes Escape{var:endheading} The villain attempts to capture the {lib:synonym#troupe}, but they still have a slim chance of escape!
Cliffhanger{var:endheading} A shocking turn takes the {lib:synonym#troupe} by surprise. What will they do? That is a different story...
Greater Threat{var:endheading} A menace much greater than anyone anticipated is revealed!

tables.name: myth
tables.explanation: Scenes once rumoured to have existed.

tables.name: fantasy
tables.explanation: Scenes for fantasy worlds (with no basis in myth).

tables.name: modern
tables.explanation: Scenes for modern worlds.

tables.name: futuristic
tables.explanation: Scenes for science fiction worlds.

tables.name: advantage revealed beat
tables.explanation: Beats that reveal an advantage.
entries: A {lib:actant#mentor} here knows about an advantage that the  {lib:synonym#troupe} could maybe use to advance their plans.
A {lib:actant#traitor} here knows about a tool that the  {lib:synonym#troupe} could use.

tables.name: ambush beat
tables.explanation: Beats for surprise battles with the enemy's troops.
entries: The {lib:synonym#troupe} spot enemy troops that are oblivious to their presence.

tables.name: battle beat
tables.explanation: Beats for battles with the enemy's troops.
entries: The villain's forces arrive to battle the {lib:synonym#troupe} in full force.

tables.name: betrayal beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the adventurers are betrayed (by a traitor, shapeshifter, tempter, trickster, etc).

tables.name: chase beat
tables.explanation: Beats for chasing the minions.
entries: A group of {lib:minion#summary}s spots the {lib:synonym#troupe} and attempts to flee and warn their master.

tables.name: combat beat
tables.explanation: Beats with hostile creatures (guardian, minion, monster, beast, rival, etc.)
entries: This is the lair of a {lib:actant#hostile}.
A {lib:actant#hostile} is waiting here, ready to attack.

tables.name: competition beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes have to compete with someone (rival, mentor, etc.)
entries: A {lib:actant#competitive} presents a challenge to the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: confrontation beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes confront the enemy in a non-physial fight.
entries: A {lib:minion#summary} sent by the villain issues a warning to the {lib:synonym#troupe}.
The villain sends a threat to intimidate the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: contest beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes enter a ritualized contest.

tables.name: distraction beat
tables.explanation: Beats that lead astray (shapeshifter, trickster, tempter, traitor, red herring, smoke screen, etc.)

tables.name: duel beat
tables.explanation: Beats where a hero fights the enemy one-on-one.
entries: The villain's representative challenges a champion of the {lib:synonym#troupe} to one-on-one armed combat on equal terms. The loser must agree to something that the winner wants.

tables.name: fight beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes must confront the enemy in a ritual fight.
entries: A {lib:minion#summary} champion challenges one of the {lib:synonym#troupe} to a ritual, unarmed fight.

tables.name: flavor beat
tables.explanation: Beats that create color and flavor, may bring roleplaying opportunities (plant, animal, tempter, traitor, item, wonder, etc.)

tables.name: hazard beat
tables.explanation: Beats that put the adventurers in danger (hazard, etc.)

tables.name: help beat
tables.explanation: Beats that offer help (mentor, ally, etc.)

tables.name: hidden weakness beat
tables.explanation: Beats that reveal a weakness in the enemy.
entries: A {lib:actant#friendly} can be found here. If treated well, they can reveal a secret that can be used against the villain.
A {lib:actant#mentor} knows about the villain's fear that maybe could be used to gain an advantage.
Hidden here is a weapon that can be an effective asset against the villain.
If a {actant#traitor} found here can be befriended, they can tell the {lib:synonym#troupe} about a traitor in the enemy's faction.

tables.name: hindrance beat
tables.explanation: Beats that slow down, use resources, or otherwise hinder the adventurers (rival, trickster, lock, door, etc).

tables.name: information beat
tables.explanation: Beats that offer information (mentor, trickster, clue, shapeshifter, traitor, red herring, etc.)

tables.name: monster beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes face a monstrosity.

tables.name: pursuit beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes are escaping the enemy.
entries: A far superior force of {lib:minion#summary}s spots the {lib:synonym#troupe} and starts a chase.

tables.name: race beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes race the opposition.
entries: A {lib:minion#summary} tries to reach the goal before the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: rescue beat
tables.explanation: Beats where a prisoner (captive, mentor, ally, shapeshifter, tempter, traitor, trickster, animal, monster, minion, rival, etc.) can be rescued and perhaps befriended.
entries: A {lib:actant#helpless} awaits to be rescued from {predicament}.

tables.name: resource beat
tables.explanation: Beats that offer new resources (artifact, key, tool, treasure, plant, animal, information, red herring, etc).

tables.name: revelation beat
tables.explanation: Beats that reveal the whole story to the proragonists.
entries: If an agreement can be negotiated, {lib:actant#mentor} can reveal {revelation}.
If convinced of the motivations of the {lib:synonym#troupe}, a {lib:actant#traitor} here may reveal {revelation}.

tables.name: setback beat
tables.explanation: Beats that cause the adventurers to lose progress (traitor, shapeshifter, rival, etc).
entries: A {lib:actant#competitive} causes the {lib:synonym#troupe} to lose progress.

tables.name: sidetrack beat
tables.explanation: Beats providing temporary diversion (tricster, tempter, sense of wonder, comic relief, etc.)
entries: A {lib:actant#deceptive} causes a temporary diversion for the {lib:synonym#troupe}.

tables.name: skirmish beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the heroes enter a small battle.
entries: The {lib:synonym#troupe} encounters underpowered troops of the enemy. If the enemy is about to lose, they attempt to flee.

tables.name: trap beat
tables.explanation: Beats with traps.
entries: A trap has been set here: {lib:trap#detail}

tables.name: trial beat
tables.explanation: Beats where the adventurers must prove themselves (rival, mentor, trickster, etc).
entries: A {lib:actant#friendly} requires the {lib:synonym#troupe} to prove their mettle.

tables.name: trick beat
tables.explanation: Beats that require a clever approach.

tables.name: warning beat
tables.explanation: The heroes receive a warning of things to come.
entries: {lib:actant#ally} approaches the {lib:synonym#troupe} to tell them details about the danger that is looming ahead.
A {lib:clue} hints about the dangers that lie ahead.
